intro: Sloanea emarginata, commonly known as the Margined Sloanea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lanceolate leaves with a distinctive wavy margin. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
